header.azureBillingInvoiceGuide: There are amount differences between Billing Invoice and Billing menus because the two menus use different methods to display the data. The Billing Invoice displays the amount based on the invoice, and the Billing shows the amount based on usage.

detectionAlert.decrease: The cost for the current month is lower than the actual {costType}.
detectionAlert.mix: The cost for the current month is higher than the actual {increaseType}, and lower than {decreaseType}.
detectionAlert.checkReason: Look at the predicted causes below, and find out more in Cost Analytics page.

cautionInfoForDate.#2: If you set the send date before 11th it is before the confirmed date so the amount may differ from the ones after the confirmed date.

You are going to delete {dashboardName}.

Do you really want to delete this dashboard?

You must have at least one dashboard.

saveAsNewDashboardPopup.title: Save as New Dashboard

dashboardCommon.forecastThisMonthTooltip: This is estimated cost based on your usage pattern.

yearCostFcst.forecastOneYearTooltip: 1-Year forecasted cost based on the training data of your past cloud cost pattern.

dashboardCostMonthToDate.editCostMonthToDate: Edit Month to Date Cost Widget
dashboardCostMonthToDate.title: Month to Date Cost Widget
dashboardCostMonthToDate.desc: This shows the total cloud service cost incurred in this month to date as well as the change in percentage and the amount compared to the last month to date. If you are using more than one Cloud Service, add multiple Month to Date widgets to the User Dashboard for a quick look.

dashboardEstimatedCost.editEstimatedCost: Edit Forecasted Month End Cost Widget
dashboardEstimatedCost.title: Forecasted Month End Cost Widget
dashboardEstimatedCost.desc: Based on your current usage pattern in this month to date, this widget estimates the total usage for the month and calculate the cost as well as the change in percentage and the amount compared to the last month to date.  If you are using more than one Cloud Service, add multiple Forecasted Month End Cost widgets to the User Dashboard for a quick look.

dashboardYearCostFcst.title: 1-Year Ahead Cost Forecast Widget
dashboardYearCostFcst.desc1: Using past cloud cost data as training data, this widget is based on the AWS SageMaker DeepAR algorithm, which is a time series forecasting algorithm, to forecast 1-year ahead cloud costs.
dashboardYearCostFcst.desc2: If you are using more than one Cloud Service, add multiple 1-Year Ahead Cost Forecast widgets to the User Dashboard for a quick look.
dashboardYearCostFcst.desc3: This widget is currently available only for AWS users.

dashboardSharing.sharingModalContent1: Copy the following link and send it to the user you want to share by instant messaging or email.
dashboardSharing.sharingModalContent2: The user can view the shared dashboard by accessing the link you sent.
dashboardSharing.copyErr: An error occurred while copying link.
dashboardSharing.shareTooltip1: You can set the sharing range of the selected dashboard.
dashboardSharing.shareTooltip2: Share with filters: All settings with filters applied to the widgets will be shared.
dashboardSharing.shareTooltip3: Share without filters: Other settings without filters applied to the widgets will be shared.
dashboardSharing.shareTooltip4: *If you select the 'Share with filters' option, you can only share the dashboard with users in the same company.

generateDashboard.accessDenied: You have insufficient permissions on the shared dashboard to create the dashboard. Please contact your administrator.
generateDashboard.uuidIsEmpty: The shared URL is not a valid format.
generateDashboard.sharedDashboardNotExist: The dashboard you're trying to open does not exist. The link address may be invalid, or the dashboard may have been deleted.
generateDashboard.overMaxDashboardCount: Dashboard cannot be created because you have reached the maximum number of dashboards that can be created.
generateDashboard.unknownCase: Failed to create the dashboard. Please contact your administrator.

editWidgetForm.title: Edit Cost Widget
editWidgetForm.dateRange: Date Range (The date range includes this month or this week.)

placeholder.reachedMax: You can't add more than {max} items.

dashboardCost.title: Cost Widget
dashboardCost.desc1: This widget offers multiple filter criteria to suit your needs. You can easily change the filter criteria from the widget card view without opening the Edit Widget panel.
dashboardCost.desc2: Depends on the Cloud Service you want to view, the filters may vary as follows:

productPortion.title: Product Cost Breakdown Widget
productPortion.desc: Cloud Service cost is categorized by product category and the cost is analyzed and either shown in actual amount or the percentage of the total cost.

portionBy.title: Cost Breakdown Widget
portionBy.desc1: This widget is similar to the Cost widget, offering multiple filter criteria. With this widget, the Cloud Service cost is further analyzed and either shown in actual amount or the percentage of the selected criteria from the total cost. You can easily change the filter criteria from the widget card view without opening the Edit Widget panel.
portionBy.desc2: Depends on the Cloud Service you want to view, the filters may vary as follows:
portionBy.descAWS: AWS: By Account, Product, Region, Tag, Service Group

multiVendorDashboardCost.title: Integrated Cost Widget
multiVendorDashboardCost.desc: If you are using more than one Cloud Service, select multiple Cloud Services in this single widget to view the integrated cost breakdown. Depends on the Cloud Service you want to view, the filters may vary as follows:
multiVendorDashboardCost.descExceptGCP: Not including GCP: By Account, Product, Region

compareCostTrend.title: Cost Trend Widget
compareCostTrend.desc: Select a Cloud Service and the period to see your past and current cost trends in one widget. Dates are shown on X-axis and the usage costs are shown on the Y-axis. Bring the mouse pointer to a certain point in line to see detailed information. If you are using more than one Cloud Service, add multiple Cost Trend widgets to the User Dashboard for a quick look.

topCost.title: Top 5 Costs Widget
topCost.desc1: According to the filter criteria, the 5 highest cost incurring items are shown in a pie chart, along with the actual cost and the percentage. You can easily change the filter criteria from the widget card view without opening the Edit Widget panel.
topCost.desc2: Depends on the Cloud Service you want to view, the filters may vary as follows:

thisMonthSoFarVsSamePeriodOfLastMonthWit.#1: It displays cost anomalies and the result of comparing month to date with the same period last month.

abnormalChange.abnormalChangeColumnSaveTooltip: The column order you set will be saved.
abnormalChange.abnormalChangeNotiTooltip: You will receive a cost anomaly alert based on your widget settings.

anomalyDetectIncreasedTextOptions.latest3DayTotalVs3DaysBefore: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, average cost of last 3 days was increased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the average of the preceding 3 days.
anomalyDetectIncreasedTextOptions.latest7DayTotalVs7DaysBefore: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, average cost of last 7 days was increased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the average of the preceding 7 days.
anomalyDetectIncreasedTextOptions.latestTotalCostVsAverageCostOfLatest7Day: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, cost of last collected date was increased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the average of last 7 days.
anomalyDetectIncreasedTextOptions.thisMonthSoFarVsSamePeriodOfLastMonth: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, month to date cost was increased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the same period last month.

anomalyDetectDecreasedTextOptions.latest3DayTotalVs3DaysBefore: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, average cost of last 3 days was decreased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the average of the preceding 3 days.
anomalyDetectDecreasedTextOptions.latest7DayTotalVs7DaysBefore: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, average cost of last 7 days was decreased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the average of the preceding 7 days.
anomalyDetectDecreasedTextOptions.latestTotalCostVsAverageCostOfLatest7Day: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, cost of last collected date was decreased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the average of last 7 days.
anomalyDetectDecreasedTextOptions.thisMonthSoFarVsSamePeriodOfLastMonth: In a total of {count} {viewBy}, month to date cost was decreased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the same period last month.

abnormalChange.aiPredictionCostVsActualcost: AI prediction cost vs. Actual cost
abnormalChange.sensitivityTooltip: When AI prediction cost drifts out of sensitivity range, it detects anomalies and send alerts. Low sensitivity will result in less notifications while high sensitivity will result in more.
abnormalChange.aiAnomalyDetectionIncreased: Actual cost of {vendor} was increased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the AI prediction cost.
abnormalChange.aiAnomalyDetectionDecreased: Actual cost of {vendor} was decreased by {cost} ({rate}%) compared to the AI prediction cost.

message.#1: Have you ever been charged more than expected for cloud service?
message.#2: AI Cost Anomaly Detection will detect cost anomaly and quickly deliver an alert to you if your cost changes suddenly,
message.#3: so you can monitor costs more closely.
message.#4: (It is available only in MCMP paid version.)

message.#1: There is no cloud cost and usage data available.
message.#2: AI Cost Anomaly Detection is unavailable until up to 14 days after using cloud service.

pattern02.button: Contact us about AI-based Cost Anomaly Detection

message.#1: We are learning your usage patterns.
message.#2: AI Cost Anomaly Detection is unavailable until up to 7 days after subscribing to service.

pattern03.button: Contact us about AI-based Cost Anomaly Detection

alertDetail.title: Alert Details
alertDetail.tooltip: You can check the details of alerts that were detected by AI algorithms, and identify the analysis results and anomaly detection factors.
alertDetail.emailNotification: Contact us about AI Cost Anomaly Detection if you want to find out more about anomaly detection.

abnormalChange.dontSupportVendorContent: This widget currently supports AWS only. Other cloud vendors will be supported soon.
abnormalChange.dontSupportVendorContent2: Other cloud vendors will be supported soon.
abnormalChange.whatIsAIAnomalyDetection: What is AI-based Cost Anomaly Detection?
abnormalChange.whatIsUserRuleAnomalyDetection: What is Custom Cost Anomaly Detection?
abnormalChange.explainAIAnomalyDetection: AI-based Cost Anomaly Detection feature trains and analyzes your cloud usage and cost data with machine learning algorithms in real time. The feature detects unusual usage patterns everyday, and sends alerts based on AI detection sensitivity set by user.
abnormalChange.explainUserRuleAnomalyDetection: Custom Cost Anomaly Detection analyzes cloud usage and costs based on custom rules, detects anomalies when the rules are not met, and sends alerts.
abnormalChange.aiAlertBandTooltip: Classify the difference by a specified amount between the actual cost and the predicted AI cost to set alerts.
abnormalChange.userRuleAlertBandTooltip: Set to receive alarms if there is an abnormal cost difference between the two periods. Depending on the amount of difference, the user can set it to Critical, Major, Minor, and sends alarms.
abnormalChange.anomalyDetectAlertSend: Send alert when cost anomaly is detected
abnormalChange.includeLowerLevel: Include recipients for lower alert level when sending an alert
abnormalChange.invalidValue: Cost anomaly alert band setting is incorrect.

aiAnomalyDetectionDescriptions.#1: It may take at least 7 days before AI service is available.
aiAnomalyDetectionDescriptions.#2: System creates a model by analyzing your usage patterns for the last 14 days (7 days if it is initial setup).
aiAnomalyDetectionDescriptions.#3: System analyzes and retrains your usage patterns on a daily basis.

content.editWidget:
We are giving you the feature to change widget to suit your needs.
This allows you to edit widget to keep track of important content and information.
content.dashboardTemplateSelection:
We are providing multiple dashboards.
You can add multiple dashboards for different purposes.
content.createDashboard:
You just created a new dashboard based on template.
Now you can customize your dashboard.
content.addWidget:
We are providing multiple widgets.
You can add several widgets for your needs.
content.customizeWidget: You can edit, duplicate, delete a widget or change its location with drag and drop.

aiModelAnalysisResult.title: Anomaly Detection Methods
aiModelAnalysisResult.summary: {n} AI models detected anomalies after analyzing cloud usage and cost data on {forecastDate}.
aiModelAnalysisResult.descARIMA: Time series model that predicts trend and seasonality by combining AR (Autoregression) model and MA (Moving Average) model.
aiModelAnalysisResult.descETS: Time series model that assigns exponentially decreasing weights for newest to oldest data. The weights are exponentially decreasing over time.
aiModelAnalysisResult.descPCR: The model uses principal component analysis to find patterns that induce abnormal phenomena, and infers its influence by using regression analysis.
aiModelAnalysisResult.tooltip: When two or more AI models detect anomalous spend, they are derived as AI Cost Anomalies.

aiAnomalyChangeTop5.title: Top 5 AI Accumulated Alerts by Rate of Change
aiAnomalyChangeTop5.tooltip: Accumulated Rate of Change is the actual costs incurred from the service, out of the total cost changes, and expressed as percentage.

userAnomalyAlertTop5.title: Top 5 Accumulated Alerts by Custom Rule
userAnomalyAlertTop5.tooltip: Analysis criteria can be set by account, product, and region.

anomaly.anomalyListTooltip: This is the list of alerts sent when an abnormal cost was detected based on AI or custom rules set by user. Click the Detailed View to see details.

aiPossibleCause.title: Anomaly Detection Factors

tooltip.gridInfo: Anomaly detection factors are displayed in descending order of 'Influence score'
tooltip.propInfo:
AI analyzes usage changes and
interconnections of each service to identify
anomaly detection factors, and expresses
how the factor affects the influence score of
cost anomalies as a percentage.

aiPossibleCause.Information: AI possible causes are listed by service in the order of influence score up to the top 90%, and the remaining 10% are provided as Others.

welcomeTitle.anomalyAlarm2: Cost anomaly detection service helps you to reduce your cloud costs by detecting anomalies.

welcome.welcomeContent:
We're here to give you a quick tour of this new feature.
Do you want to try new {serviceName}?

dashboard.customizeWidget: Edit, Duplicate, Delete and Move Widget

anomalyAlarm.userRuleDescription:
Custom Cost Anomaly Detection analyzes cloud usage and costs with custom rules,
detects unusual usage patterns, and sends alerts.
anomalyAlarm.userRuleContent:
â€¢ Set up custom rules in widget.
â€¢ Send an alert when the value does not meet the custom rule.
â€¢ Monitor your cloud costs by product, account, and region.
anomalyAlarm.aiDescription: AI Cost Anomaly Detection learns from your cloud usage and cost data, and then analyzes your cloud usage and costs in real time with trained machine learning algorithms, detects unusual usage patterns, and sends alerts.
anomalyAlarm.aiContent:
â€¢ Analyze your usage and costs with machine learning algorithms.
â€¢ Costs that exceeds the predicted range are immediately detected, and send alarms about that.
â€¢ AI enabled cost detection allows you to easily identify the cause and solution by checking the details of detected anomalies.
(It is available only in paid version.)

inventory.inventoryDesc: Savings Plans Inventory shows the list of Savings Plans expired and currently owned.

totalSummary.title: Summary
totalSummary.description: Utilization shows the percentage of Savings Plans commitments you are utilizing across your compute usage.

netSavingRate.description: Savings rate is calculated based on the usage covered by Savings Plans and the On-Demand cost for that usage over the selected time period.

netSavingCost.description: The cost of the usage covered by Savings Plans is converted into an On-Demand unit price.

toolTips.onDemandCost: Savings Plans usage converted into On-Demand rate.

utilizationRate.description: The percentage of the cost used from the commitment over the selected time period.

toolTips.totalCommitmentCost: The price of the Savings Plan commitment over the selected period.
toolTips.usedCommitmentCost: The cost of the Savings Plan commitment used over the selected period.

transitionStatus.title: Utilization Trend
transitionStatus.description: This chart shows the utilization trend in percentage (%).

totalSummary.title: Summary
totalSummary.description: Coverage shows how much of your compute usage was covered by Savings plans.

usageStatus.title: Savings Plan Covered Usage
usageStatus.description: The usage will be displayed by hour, not cost (USD).

coverageRate.description: The proportion of the Savings Plan costs that is allocated to computing resources over the selected period.

totalCost.description: The total cost of computing resources used that can be covered by Savings Plans over the selected period.

toolTips.savingsPlanCost: Savings Plans spend over the selected time period.
toolTips.onDemandCost: On-demand spend not covered by Savings Plans over the selected period.

transitionStatus.title: Coverage Trend
transitionStatus.description: This chart shows the coverage trend in percentage (%).

alert.badFilterTermDate: Invalid date range was specified. Please try again.

savingCost.title: Estimated Monthly Savings
savingCost.description: Estimated savings over the current amount when you follow the SP commitment recommendation.

coverage.title: Estimated Coverage
coverage.description: Estimated coverage when you purchase all the recommended Savings Plans.

commitment.title: SP Commitment Recommendation
commitment.description#1: Hourly commitment amount to maximize your cost savings
commitment.description#2: Savings Plans can be purchased in

totalSummary.notice#1: Based on the EC2/Lambda/Fargate usage analysis over #days, $##.## can be saved every month if you commit $##.##/hour with {#}-year, {Type}, {Payment Option}.
totalSummary.notice#2: ##.##% can be saved compared to the current billing amount, and SP can be purchased from EC2 SP Purchase Console.
totalSummary.notice#3: The displayed costs are estimates, and it may differ from the actual costs.

modal.title: Select SP Options
modal.description#1: This matrix table shows the monthly savings and cost information for each payment option, term length, and Savings Plans type.
modal.description#2: Selected SP options will be reflected to SP recommendation analysis results.

fields.OnDemandSpendNotCoveredCost: On-Demand Cost Not Covered by Reservations

inventory.inventoryDesc: Reservations Inventory shows a list of currently owned and expired reserved instances.

totalSummary.title: Summary
totalSummary.description: Reservations Utilization shows the percentage of Reserved Instances commitments you are utilizing across your compute resource usage.

netSavingRate.description: This is the percentage of saved amount using Reservations compared to the On-Demand Instances over the selected period.

netSavingCost.description: This is the saved amount using Reservations commitment compared to the On-Demand Instances over the selected period.

toolTips.onDemandCost: Expected cost if On-Demand Instances were utilized instead of Reservations by converting the RI usage cost into On-Demand rates.

utilizationRate.description: The percentage of the cost used from the total commitment over the selected period.

toolTips.totalCommitmentCost: The amount of the Reservations commitment over the selected period.
toolTips.usedCommitmentCost: The amount of the Reservations commitment used over the selected period.

transitionStatus.title: Utilization Trend
transitionStatus.description: This chart shows the utilization trend in percentage(%).

totalSummary.title: Summary
totalSummary.description: Reservations Coverage shows the percentage of Reserved Instances cost out of total resource cost over a specific period.

coverageStatus.title: Coverage Status
coverageStatus.onDemandCost: On-Demand Cost Not Covered by Reservations

costStatus.title: Amount Status
costStatus.description: Amount Used and Reserved Instances show usage converted to On-Demand pricing.

reservedNfCoverage.description: The percentage of utilized Reservations of total resource usage over selected period.

reservedCostCoverage.description: The percentage of the cost of Reservations resources among all resources used over selected period.

totalNfUsage.description: The percentage of total reservations usage over selected period.

reservedCostTotal.description: The total cost of the computing resources used that can be covered by RI commitments over the selected period.

toolTips.onDemandNfUsage: On-Demand Instance Usage over selected period.
toolTips.reservedOnDemandCost: Reservations usage cost over selected period.
toolTips.onDemandCost: Actual On-Demand Instance cost over selected period.

transitionStatus.title: Coverage Trend
transitionStatus.description: This chart shows the coverage trend in percentage(%).

alert.badFilterTermDate: Invalid date range was specified. Please try again.

inventory.inventoryDesc: Reservations Inventory shows a list of currently owned and expired reserved instances.

transitionStatus.title: Utilization Trend
transitionStatus.description: This chart shows the utilization trend in percentage(%).

totalSummary.title: Summary
totalSummary.description: Reservations Utilization shows the percentage of Reserved Instances commitments you are utilizing across your compute resource usage.

netSavingRate.description: This is the percentage of saved amount using Reservations compared to the On-Demand Instances over the selected period.

netSavingCost.description: This is the saved amount using Reservations commitment compared to the On-Demand Instances over the selected period.

toolTips.onDemandCost: Expected cost if On-Demand Instances were utilized instead of Reservations by converting the RI usage cost into On-Demand rates.

utilizationRate.description: The percentage of the cost used from the total commitment over the selected period.

toolTips.totalCommitmentCost: The amount of the Reservations commitment over the selected period.
toolTips.usedCommitmentCost: The amount of the Reservations commitment used over the selected period.

savingCost.title: Estimated Monthly Savings
savingCost.description: Estimated VM savings compared to current costs when you purchase all the recommended RIs

rcmdQnt.title: RI Purchase Recommendations
rcmdQnt.description#1: Number of RIs to purchase to maximize your cost savings
rcmdQnt.description#2: VM RI can be purchased in the Azure VM Reservations Portal.

recommendations.notice#1: Based on the VM usage analysis for {lbkPd} days, you can save {netSavings} per month when you purchase {rcmdQnt} RI types for {term}-year and single subscription.
recommendations.notice#2: You can save {savingsRate}% compared to the current cost, and you can purchase it from the VM Reservations in Azure Portal.
recommendations.notice#3: The displayed costs are estimates, and it may differ from the actual costs.

fields.OnDemandSpendNotCoveredCost: On-Demand Cost Not Covered by Reservations
